The Plucky Squire: Devolver Deluxe Edition is on sale for its lowest price since its February launch. You can pluck this deal from Amazon for $40 (was $55) on PlayStation 5 or Nintendo Switch. The PS5 deal is also available at Walmart, but the $40 price for Switch is only at Amazon. This collectible version of one of the most charming games of 2024 is packaged in an oversized box containing a physical copy of The Plucky Squire as well as a 108-page art book and a digital soundtrack.

The Plucky Squire originally released on digital storefronts last September for $30. There's also a standard physical edition without the extras for $30 on PS5 or $33 on Switch (was $35).

The Plucky Squire Devolver Deluxe Edition

$40 (was $55) for PS5 or Nintendo Switch | Compatible with Switch 2

If you're unfamiliar with the game, The Plucky Squire is an adventure game that mixes multiple genres, including top-down action-adventure, side-scrolling platforming, and more.

The Plucky Squire is one of those games that almost makes toomuch sense for the art book treatment. After all, the game shares its title with the book inside the game.

You play as Jot, a character in the The Plucky Squire book where the game takes place. Unfortunately, Jot is forced out of his home by Humgrump. This sets up The Plucky Squire's unique visual and gameplay style. The Plucky Squire melds hand-drawn 2D and colorful 3D graphics as Jot ventures forth on his adventure outside and inside of the book. It's an ambitious debut game from indie studio All Possible Futures. The studio was co-founded by ex-Pokemon art director James Turner, and Jonathan Biddle, who served as creative director on another hand-drawn Zelda-like indie, The Swords of Ditto.

It earned a 9/10 in GameSpot's The Plucky Squire review.
